options.text: The bowel is covered by 3 layers

options.label: C
options.text: Musculoskeletal anomalies are the most common associated defects

questions.correct_answer: C. Musculoskeletal anomalies are the most common associated defects
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Musculoskeletal anomalies are the most common associated defects

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Omphalocele is a congenital defect covered by a sac with three layers and is frequently associated with syndromes and cardiac anomalies. Musculoskeletal defects are not the most common associated abnormalities.

questions.text: 2-month-old child is brought to pediatrician by parents with h/o intermittent groin pain. Examination is essentially normal, except palpable thickening of spermatic cord. What is the management?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Elective surgical exploration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Congenital inguinal hernia presenting with a thickened spermatic cord in infants should be managed with elective surgical exploration to prevent complications such as incarceration or strangulation.

questions.text: Which of these structures is not always resected in Whipple’ procedure?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Pyloric shincter

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The pyloric sphincter is not always resected during a Whipple procedure. In pylorus-preserving pancreaticoduodenectomy , the pylorus is spared to maintain normal gastric emptying, unlike in the traditional Whipple procedure where the pylorus is removed.
  • ➤ pyloric sphincter
  • ➤ pylorus-preserving pancreaticoduodenectomy

questions.text: Which of these cannot be classified predominantly as a symptom of storage issues in bladder?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Straining

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Straining is a voiding symptom related to bladder outlet obstruction, whereas frequency, urgency, and nocturia are storage symptoms related to bladder irritation or overactivity.
  • ➤ Straining
  • ➤ frequency, urgency, and nocturia

questions.text: Which of these is the earliest lesion to be seen in Renal tuberculosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Papillary ulcer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In renal tuberculosis, the earliest lesion is a papillary ulcer in the renal parenchyma. Imaging findings, such as "moth-eaten" calyces and ghost calyces, occur at later stages, while golf hole ureter appears due to extensive fibrosis.
  • ➤ earliest lesion
  • ➤ papillary ulcer
  • ➤ golf hole ureter
